title: Exit Modal display when user Log Out
custom_preconds:
1. Download the App from the Microsoft Store.
2. Login with a valid account.
custom_steps:
1. User launches the MLB App
2. User Navigates to Settings.
3. Click Log Out

WHEN the user click Logout on the Settings page
custom_expected:
THEN Exit modal should appear.

User should see the following text in the Exit application modal.
"You are about to log out of your MLB user account.
To view MLB.TV you must log in with a valid MLB account.
To view subscription content, an MLB.TV account is required."
![](index.php?/attachments/get/8923742)

title: Login: Verify Login success
custom_steps:
WHEN we access the MLB.tv app 
AND we go to Settings and select SIGN IN 
AND we enter valid mlb.com credentials
custom_expected:
THEN the credentials will be accepted 
AND we will be logged in 
AND we will advanced to the Scores or Home screen (depending on what user has set).

title: Login: Verify Login failed
custom_steps:
WHEN we access MLb.tv 
AND we enter invalid MLB.com credentials

need Test Case Result Image
custom_expected:
THEN a Login Error Message will appear under the Password field 
AND a message regarding 'Invalid email or password' will be stated 
AND all formatting and text will be readable . 

KNOWN issues accepted by Product: the logo at top of screen will partially be pushed up and off screen when error message displays (to accommodate the password entry field not being covered by keyboard)

need Test Case Expected Result Image

title: Authenticated  -> Verify Settings Page
custom_preconds:
1. Download the App from the Microsoft Store.
2. Login with a valid account.
custom_steps:
1. User should Launch the MLB App 
2. Select login on the Top Nav
3. User should give the correct credentials and log in with the Monthly or Annual account.
4. Navigate to Top Nav and select the Settings option
5. Verify the Settings page
custom_expected:
User should see MLB logo on the top *right* corner and user should see the Top Nav tabs on the top right-hand side.

User should see the following options on the right side to choose from: 

Settings List: 
* Log in/ Log out
* Favorite Team
* Followed Team
* Hide Spoilers
* Auto Play Live Featured Game
* Select App Start View
* In-Game Alerts
* Terms of Service
* Contact MLB Support 

User should see the following text on the left side of the User is Logged in: 
• Logged In As: 
<Logged in user's account>

![](index.php?/attachments/get/8923743)

title: Able to set and change favorite team via settings
Able to follow and unfollow a team under followed teams
Toggle the hide spoilers
Toggle Autoplay featured content
Toggle the App Start View
Free users can click on Get MLB.TV and select a package then login
Verify Games Page
custom_preconds:
1. User should download the App from the Microsoft Store.
2. User should log in with a valid account.
custom_steps:
1. Launch the MLB App 
2. Navigate to top nav and select the *Games* option
3. Verify the *Games* page
custom_expected:
1. Should see the landing page with the MLB logo on the upper left side, the MENU option on the top right side of the screen.
2. Should see *Today's Games* on the left side. Should see *Left*, *Right* and *Calander* buttons on the right side of the screen (under settings).
3. The main screen area should be filled with current fixtures/ games along with the respective scores for that selected day.

Note: The scores for these fixtures will be shown or hidden based on the option selected in the Settings for *Hide Scores*.

title: Verify Final->Game Score
custom_preconds:
1. Download the App from the Microsoft Store.
2. Login with a valid account (Annual / Monthly)
custom_steps:
1. User should Launch the MLB App 
2. Navigate to Top Nav and select the Games option
3. Select the previous date.

When the user selects the previous date and select the Final tile
custom_expected: Each Game tile below for a date in the past shows game Final State, score, pitcher data, and team record information.

title: Left Right arrows and calendar is clickable
custom_steps:
1. Navigate to the games page
2. Click on the Left Arrow
3. Click on the Right Arrow
4. Click on the calendar page
custom_expected:
1. Clicking on the Left Arrow should navigate you to the previous page
2. Clicking on the Right Arrow should navigate you to the next page
3. Clicking on the calendar page should open up a new calendar page

title: Today button is clickable on Games calendar page
custom_steps:
1. Go to Games page
2. Click on the Calendar button
3. Navigate to a different month (previous or next)
4. Click on the Today button on the top right
custom_expected: Clicking on the Today button on the top right of the calendar page should take you back to today's Games page.

title: Verify that Condensed and Recap feeds appear for game tile
Authenticated -> Verify Calendar View
custom_preconds:
1. Download the App from the Microsoft Store.
2. Login with a valid account.
custom_steps:
1. User should Launch the MLB App 
2. Navigate to Top Nav and select the Scores option
3. Select Calendar Icon in the Scores page

WHEN the user click on Calendar Icon
custom_expected:
THEN User should view the 
* Current Month on top of the screen
* The current month 
, with the cursor on the current day per the home page, and a white border around today's date

title: Play VOD Video from hero
custom_preconds:
1. Download the App from the Microsoft Store.
2. Login with a valid account.
custom_steps:
1. User launches the MLB App
2. Navigate to Top Nav and select the Home option

WHEN the user selects Homepage game.
WHEN the user selects the VOD.
custom_expected:
THEN user should able to play a VOD Video.
Note:
If the User selects a video and experiences a network/playback error, the user should see the network error and a retry option.

title: Verify FF/RW on VOD Video
custom_preconds:
1. Download the App from the Microsoft Store.
2. Login with a valid account.
custom_steps:
1. User launches the MLB App
2. Navigate to Top Nav and select the Home option

WHEN the user selects Homepage game.
WHEN the user selects/Play the VOD.
custom_expected:
THEN user should able to play a VOD Video.
THEN user should FF and RW the VOD Video using the remote and FF/RW box should appear.

title: Play VOD video from featured carousel
custom_preconds:
1. Download the App from the Microsoft Store.
2. Login with a valid account.
3. Select a Favorite team and a couple of Following teams
custom_steps:
1. User launches the MLB App
2. Navigate to Top Nav and select the Home option

WHEN the user selects Homepage game.
WHEN the user navigates to Game Carousels
custom_expected: THEN user should see the VOD - Basic carousel using small thumbnails don’t have any entitlement requirements.

title: Play SVOD video from featured carousel
custom_preconds:
1. Download the App from the Microsoft Store.
2. Login with a valid Yearly/ Monthly entitlement account.
3. Select a Favorite team and a couple of Following teams.
custom_steps:
1. User launches the MLB App
2. Navigate to Top Nav and select the Home option

WHEN the user selects Homepage game.
WHEN the user navigates to Game Carousels.
custom_expected:
THEN the user should see the Featured SVOD.
And the user should see a larger ‘Featured’ carousel pattern. It Will usually apply to Featured SVOD only.

title: Play SVOD Video from hero
custom_preconds:
1. User should download the App from the Microsoft Store.
2. User should log in with a valid account.
custom_steps:
1. Launch the MLB App.
2. Navigate to Top Nav and select the Home option.

WHEN the user selects Homepage game.
WHEN the user selects the SVOD.
custom_expected:
THEN user should see the below feature:

|| WHEN the user selects the SVOD(Featured on MLB.TV carousel)|THEN the user should able to play an SVOD Video. 
|| WHEN the user selects the previously been watching SVOD Video | THEN the video should resume playing where the user left off earlier.     
|| WHEN the user experiences a playback error | THEN the user should see the playback error and a retry option.   
|| WHEN the user FF and RW the SVOD Video using the remote | THEN the user should see FF/RW box should appear

title: Verify SVOD Lock for Free User
custom_preconds:
1. User should download the App from the Microsoft Store.
2. User should log in with a valid account.
custom_steps:
1. Launch the MLB App.
2. Navigate to Top Nav and select the Home option.

WHEN the user selects Homepage game.
WHEN the user selects the SVOD.
custom_expected:
THEN user should see the below feature:

|| WHEN the user selects the SVOD(Featured on MLB.TV)|THEN user should not be able to play an SVOD Video. And the user should see the lock icon on SVOD content that requires a subscription.
|| WHEN the user selects a tile that requires a subscription|THEN the user should see a modal with the options to Upgrade MLB.TV or Cancel

title: Authenticated -> Free account
custom_preconds:
User should download the App from ROKU Channel store. https://channelstore.roku.com/browse
User should login with the Free account


Note: 
For SVOD, upon launching the App, the user lands on Videos page.
For SVOD, Free account user should not see "Featured on MLB.tv" carousel.
custom_steps:
1. User launches the MLB App(User should land on Videos page)
2. User selects/play any asset
custom_expected:
The playback should start streaming, and the asset should play with no issues

Note: if wifi strength is poor, the bitrate of video playback should be lower; video quality may not be as good, but it is intended to prevent stuttering playback when device is unable to download and playback the higher bitrate/quality video.

title: CC: Verify that Closed Captioning is available for live streams
custom_steps:
WHEN we play the Live Linear video stream 
AND we open the MTC media transport control 
AND navigate down to STATS & GAMES dshelf 
AND then navigate right to select OPTIONS 
AND we bring CAPTIONS option into focus and select, to toggle on Closed Captioning
custom_expected: Then the Closed Captioning will turn on accordingly

title: CC: Verify that Closed Captioning is available for Video on Demand streams
custom_steps:
WHEN we access any VOD archive content 
AND we begin playback
custom_expected:
THEN we will be able to successfully enable Closed Captioning 
AND we will be able to successfully disable Closed Captioning

title: CC: Verify that CC setting is retained
custom_steps:
WHEN we exit the application 
AND we launch a new stream
custom_expected: THEN the Closed Captioning setting will still be ON when we access the application again

title: CC: Verify user can toggle Closed Captioning "On"
custom_steps:
WHEN we access a video stream 
AND playback begins
custom_expected: THEN we can turn Closed Captioning ON

title: CC: Verify user can toggle Closed Captioning "Off"
custom_steps:
WHEN we begin video playback 
AND we turn on Closed Captioning 
AND we attempt to turn OFF Closed Captioning
custom_expected: THEN Closed Captioning will stop appearing for the video feed

title: CC: Verify user Closed Caption status is properly reflected
custom_steps:
WHEN we turn Closed Captioning ON 
OR we turn Closed Captioning OFF
custom_expected: THEN the current CC status will be properly reflected in the on screen controls

title: Check MTC: Details, Milestones, Games and Broadcast options
Unauthenticated->Free Game of the Day ->Verify that the Free Game of the Day should not play
custom_preconds: User should download the appropriate MLB App (dev build, test flight build, Microsoft store build)
custom_steps:
1. User launches the MLB App
2. User clicks Menu button on the Remote to invoke the Left Menu
3. Navigate and select the Scores/Video option
4. Navigate to any free game LIVE > Select feed > Launch to playback
custom_expected:
User should see the "LOG IN" option with the message below:

"MLB.TV Subscription Required.
You need an active MLB.TV subscription to view this game. MLB Single Team subscribers, click your team's broadcast. New users please visit www.mlb.tv to purchase
